alert.note: Alert for Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 10:50AM EDT until April 05 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River at Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site down to Vincennes. .Lowland flooding from excessive rainfall remains on portions of the Wabash River south of Terre Haute. Flooding on the Wabash River will persist through Wednesday afternoon for some areas. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Wabash River at Vincennes. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Some flooding at Kimmell Park in Vincennes. Agricultural lands flood in the St. Francisville, Illinois area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Tuesday /9:45 AM EDT Tuesday/ the stage was 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Tuesday /9:45 AM EDT Tuesday/ was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 7.5 feet Friday, April 15. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated this evening.
